intro: Tetradenia cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tetradenia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its simple, narrow leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are small, round, and turn from green to yellow or red as they mature. Tetradenia cuneifolia is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
